Submodules¶

api.logger module¶

class api.logger.LevelFilter(level)¶

Bases: Filter

Filter log entries by level.

Parameters:

level (int) – Maximum level of records to output

Outputs only records with a level lower than the level specified at initialisation.

Example:

f = LevelFilter(logging.WARNING)
logger.addFilter(f)

This will only output records with levels DEBUG, INFO, but not WARNING, ERROR or CRITICAL.

filter(record) → bool¶

Filters the record by level

Parameters:

record (LogRecord) – Record to filter

Returns:

True if the record level is below the specified level

Return type:

bool

api.logger.setup_logger() → Logger¶

Configures and returns the application logger.

Creates a logger, adds two handlers (for writing to files) and configures a formatter for the records.

Returns:

Configured logger

Return type:

logging.Logger

api.tools module¶

async api.tools.load_extensions(bot: Bot, extensions_dir: str, extension_prefix: str) → None¶

Loads all extensions from the specified directory into the bot.

Parameters:

  • bot (Bot) – Bot instance for loading extensions

  • extensions_dir (str) – Path to the directory with extensions

  • extension_prefix (str) – Extensions file name prefix

For each extension file in the directory, the following is performed:

  1. Loading the extension module

  2. Call bot.load_extension() to load it

  3. Logging the result

Allows to load all extensions from the directory.
